samples.current_output: Hospital delivery best! Why: 1) Emergency handling (bleeding, cord problem), 2) C-section if needed, 3) Baby complications - immediate care. Government: PHC level delivery (normal cases), higher centre referral. 102 ambulance: Free transport - call early when labour starts. Incentive: JSY + Muthulakshmi scheme - Rs.18,000+ for hospital delivery. Dai (TBA): Not trained for emergencies. Register PHC early - they plan delivery place based on risk.

samples.instruction: ASHA worker yaar? Enna help seivaanga?
samples.current_output: ASHA = Accredited Social Health Activist - village level health worker. Services: 1) Pregnant women tracking and support, 2) Child vaccination reminders, 3) Health awareness, 4) Medicine distribution (TB, malaria), 5) Nutrition counseling, 6) Family planning advice, 7) Escort to hospital, 8) COVID vaccination support. Contact: Through Village Health Nurse or PHC. Free service.

Government centres: Free treatment at district/medical college hospitals. Services: 1) Detoxification (medical supervision), 2) Rehabilitation (21-90 days), 3) Counseling, 4) Family therapy, 5) Aftercare. TN: Alcohol/drug de-addiction centres in major hospitals. Private: Verify registration with State Mental Health Authority. Helpline: De-addiction helpline for guidance. Forced admission: Only if danger to self/others.

Gargle remedies: 1) Salt + warm water (most common), 2) Turmeric + salt + warm water, 3) Honey + warm water, 4) Apple cider vinegar diluted, 5) Licorice (Athimathuram) decoction. Frequency: 3-4 times daily. Drinks: 1) Warm water throughout day, 2) Honey + lemon + warm water, 3) Tulsi tea. Avoid: Cold drinks, spicy food, shouting. Persistent: If >1 week, see ENT doctor.

samples.instruction: Medical records copy à®•à¯‡à®Ÿà¯à®•à®²à®¾à®®à®¾? Hospital à®¤à®° à®®à®±à¯à®•à¯à®•à®²à®¾à®®à®¾?
samples.current_output: Patient's absolute right! Records include: 1) Discharge summary, 2) Investigation reports, 3) Operation notes, 4) Prescription copies, 5) Bills. Hospital must provide within 72 hours of request. Cannot refuse. Charges: Nominal photocopying charges only. Digital records: Soft copy also must provide. Retention: Hospital must keep records 3 years minimum. Missing records: Hospital liable.

samples.instruction: Hospital insurance claim-à®•à¯à®•à¯ cooperate à®ªà®£à¯à®£à®² - à®à®©à¯à®© à®šà¯†à®¯à¯à®µà®¤à¯?
samples.current_output: Hospital must cooperate for cashless. Issues: 1) Won't file pre-auth, 2) Asking cash despite insurance, 3) Not providing documents. Action: 1) Escalate to hospital administration, 2) Call TPA directly, 3) Insurer helpline, 4) Pay and claim reimbursement (last resort). Network hospital agreement: They must facilitate cashless. Complaint: Insurer can de-empanel non-cooperative hospitals.

Yes! Mandatory since MHCA 2017 + IRDAI guidelines. Coverage: 1) Psychiatric hospitalization, 2) Day care treatment, 3) OPD (some policies), 4) Medicine costs. Exclusions: Some policies exclude substance abuse (check terms). Claim: Same as physical illness - cashless/reimbursement. Denied: Complaint to IRDAI, Insurance Ombudsman. Important: Don't hide history - disclose for valid claims.

samples.instruction: Marriage-à®²à¯ mental illness ground for divorce-à®†?
samples.current_output: Complex issue. Law: Mental disorder is a ground under Hindu Marriage Act, but: 1) Must be incurable/very severe, 2) Must be before marriage or continuous after, 3) Court considers treatment possibility, 4) Living together impossible. Safeguards: 1) Medical evidence needed, 2) Treatment efforts considered, 3) Maintenance rights protected. Progressive interpretation: Courts increasingly protective of mentally ill spouse.

samples.instruction: Tamil Nadu-la Ayurveda hospital enge irukku?
samples.current_output: TN Ayurveda facilities: 1) Arignar Anna Government Hospital of Indian Medicine, Chennai - Multi-AYUSH, 2) District AYUSH hospitals - Ayurveda unit available in most, 3) Selected Taluk dispensaries. Private: Many Kerala-based chains have branches (Arya Vaidya Sala, AVP). Note: TN has stronger Siddha infrastructure - Ayurveda less than Kerala. Integrated: Some allopathic hospitals have AYUSH wings with Ayurveda.

Yes! Mandatory under Clinical Establishments Act. Display: 1) Room charges (all categories), 2) ICU charges, 3) OT charges, 4) Common procedure rates, 5) Consultation fees, 6) Emergency charges. Where: Reception area, website. Not displayed: Complaint to DHS. Rate revision: Must give notice. Hidden charges: Consumer Forum complaint.

samples.instruction: Free mental health treatment enge kidaikkum?
samples.current_output: Government facilities: 1) Institute of Mental Health, Kilpauk (Chennai), 2) District Mental Health Program (DMHP) - every district, 3) Medical college psychiatry OPD, 4) Taluk/District hospital psychiatry unit. Free services: Consultation, medicines (basic), counseling. DMHP: Outreach to community, schools, PHCs. Appointment: Usually walk-in OPD or through PHC referral.

samples.instruction: Home remedies safe-à®†? à®à®ªà¯à®ªà¯‹à®¤à¯ avoid à®ªà®£à¯à®£à®£à¯à®®à¯?
samples.current_output: Some safe: Ginger for nausea, turmeric milk, salt water gargle, honey for cough (not <1 year). Avoid home remedies: 1) Serious illness (high fever, breathing difficulty), 2) When already on prescription medicines (interactions), 3) Wounds/burns (infection risk), 4) Children/pregnant (specific risks). Rule: Home remedy not working in 2-3 days = see doctor. Never apply: Cow dung on wounds, kerosene on head lice (dangerous!).

samples.instruction: Medical negligence prove à®ªà®£à¯à®£ à®à®©à¯à®© evidence à®µà¯‡à®£à¯à®®à¯?
samples.current_output: Essential evidence: 1) Complete medical records (admission to discharge), 2) Prescription copies, 3) Test reports, 4) Bills (shows what was done), 5) Consent forms, 6) Photos if applicable, 7) Witness statements (family who were present), 8) Expert medical opinion. Preserve: Original documents, don't alter. Timeline: Note dates, times of events. Digital: Screenshots of online communications.

Kayakalpa = Rejuvenation/anti-aging therapy. Purpose: Longevity, vitality, reverse aging effects. Methods: 1) Special medicines (Kayakalpa pills), 2) Dietary regimen, 3) Yoga, pranayama, 4) Lifestyle modifications. Duration: 40-90 days typically (intensive). Where: 1) NIS specialized program, 2) Selected Siddha hospitals, 3) Traditional practitioners. Not for: Acute illness, certain chronic conditions. Preparation: Requires purification therapies first.

Recommended: 1) Influenza (flu) - yearly (especially elderly, diabetics), 2) Pneumococcal - 65+ years, 3) Tetanus booster - every 10 years, 4) Hepatitis B - if not taken earlier, 5) HPV - up to 26 years, 6) COVID - as per current guidelines. Pregnancy: Tetanus, Pertussis. Travel: Yellow fever, etc. based on destination. Cost: Some free at government, others subsidized. Consult doctor for personalized schedule.

Free at: 1) PHC (Primary Health Centre), 2) Government hospitals, 3) Urban health centres. Services: 1) Registration (first trimester), 2) Regular checkups (minimum 4 ANC visits), 3) Blood/urine tests, 4) Ultrasound scans, 5) Iron/folic acid tablets, 6) Tetanus injection, 7) High risk identification. Documents: Mother and Child Protection Card issued. Important: Register early for complete care.

samples.instruction: Caste, religion à®ªà®¾à®°à¯à®¤à¯à®¤à¯ treatment refuse à®ªà®£à¯à®£à®²à®¾à®®à®¾?
samples.current_output: Absolutely ILLEGAL! Non-discrimination is fundamental right. Prohibited: 1) Caste-based denial, 2) Religion-based denial, 3) Gender discrimination, 4) Economic status discrimination, 5) Disease-based discrimination (HIV, leprosy). Action: 1) Police complaint (SC/ST Act if applicable), 2) Human Rights Commission, 3) State Medical Council, 4) Consumer Forum. Hospital license: Can be cancelled.

Yes! Siddha strong for skin: Psoriasis (Kalanjaga Padai), Eczema (Karappan), Vitiligo (Venpulli), Fungal infections, Acne. Treatments: 1) Internal medicines - blood purifiers, 2) External - specialized oils (Karappan Thailam, Punga Thailam), 3) Pattru (poultice), 4) Diet modifications. Duration: Chronic conditions need 3-6 months. Advantage: Treats root cause, not just symptoms. NIS: Special skin clinic.

Yes! Population-based screening program. Available: PHC, government hospitals. Cervical: VIA (Visual Inspection with Acetic Acid) - simple, painless. Breast: Clinical breast examination. Age: 30+ years, every 3-5 years. HPV vaccine: Available for cervical cancer prevention (9-26 years ideal). Early detection: Curable. Camps: Regular screening camps conducted. Ask at PHC.

Prakriti = Your natural body type/constitution. Types: 1) Vata (air+space) - thin, active, anxious, 2) Pitta (fire+water) - medium build, sharp intellect, irritable, 3) Kapha (earth+water) - heavy, calm, slow. Most people: Combination (Vata-Pitta, Pitta-Kapha, etc.). Importance: Treatment personalized based on Prakriti. Diagnosis: Pulse examination (Nadi Pariksha), physical examination, questionnaire. Treatment: Balances your specific imbalances.

samples.instruction: Golden hour endraal enna? Adhula hospital poganumaa?
samples.current_output: Golden hour = First 60 minutes after trauma/heart attack. Critical because: 1) Brain damage starts in minutes without oxygen, 2) Bleeding control crucial, 3) Heart attack - early treatment = more heart saved, 4) Trauma - internal bleeding stops. Action: 1) Call 108 immediately, 2) Don't move spine injury victims, 3) CPR if no pulse (if trained), 4) Control visible bleeding. Nearest hospital first - don't travel far.

Immediate: 1) Cool water (not ice) for 10-20 minutes, 2) Remove jewelry/tight items, 3) Cover with clean cloth (not cotton wool), 4) Don't apply toothpaste/butter/egg - myth!, 5) Don't break blisters. Hospital needed: 1) Large burns, 2) Face/hands/genitals, 3) Deep burns (white/charred), 4) Chemical/electrical burns, 5) Difficulty breathing (smoke inhalation). Free treatment: Government hospitals for burns.

Effective Siddha treatment! Moola Noi (piles) treatments: 1) Internal - Chitramutti Lehyam, Abhaya Arishtam, 2) External - Elathi Choornam application, Sitz bath with herbal decoction, 3) Agni karma (cauterization) for advanced, 4) Kshara application. Diet crucial: High fiber, avoid spicy. Duration: 1-2 months for mild, longer for severe. Surgery alternative: Siddha procedures for Grade 2-3 piles.

ILLEGAL! HIV/AIDS Act 2017 + Supreme Court judgments. Hospital must: 1) Provide all necessary treatment, 2) Not segregate discriminatorily, 3) Follow standard precautions (for all patients anyway), 4) Maintain confidentiality. Refusal = criminal offence + license action. Report: TANSACS, State Medical Council, police. Private hospitals also bound by this law.

samples.instruction: Private hospital registration check panradhu eppadi?
samples.current_output: Check: 1) TN Clinical Establishments Registration (mandatory), 2) Display: Registration certificate must be displayed, 3) NABH accreditation (optional but quality indicator), 4) Fire safety certificate, 5) Bio-medical waste authorization. Verify: Directorate of Medical Services (DMS) website or office. Unregistered hospital: Illegal - report to DHS. Also check: Doctor registrations displayed.
